If it works, the main problem that they will have is that it will be so bright that it will knock the atoms out of the metal that surrounds it.

If they figure out how to overcome that problem, it and reactors like it will be able to power our entire civilization on tiny amounts of seawaterÂ and have no chance of criticality (explosion) or meltdown like a fission reactor does. The worst that could happen is that the cryostat breaks and the magnets melt, releasing a cloud of completely harmless hydrogen and helium.
Oh, and it would produce enough energy that we could generate significant amounts of antimatter for, say, starship propulsion.
If you don’t think that’s the awesomest thing then get the fuck out.
